head.title: Pilgrims Have Landed On World Wide Web

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: Pilgrims Have Landed On World Wide Web

abstract.p: Society of Mayflower Descendants in Commonwealth of Pennsylvania launches a Web site; drawing (S)

block.p: The Web site of the Society of Mayflower Descendants in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania (www.sail1620.org) offers a look at the 102 English colonists who landed in Massachusetts in 1620. The site features the text of the Mayflower Compact, pages for children, information about the Pilgrims and links to other Mayflower societies. There are also biographies of famous Mayflower descendants like Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, Grandma Moses, Humphrey Bogart and a number of presidents.

The Web site of the Society of Mayflower Descendants in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania (www.sail1620.org) offers a look at the 102 English colonists who landed in Massachusetts in 1620. The site features the text of the Mayflower Compact, pages for children, information about the Pilgrims and links to other Mayflower societies. There are also biographies of famous Mayflower descendants like Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, Grandma Moses, Humphrey Bogart and a number of presidents.
Browser A selection of events and sites on the Web.
TODAY, 9 p.m. www.msnbc.com The debate between Dick Cheney and Senator Joseph Lieberman, the Republican and Democratic vice-presidential candidates, from Centre College in Danville, Ky.
MONDAY, 7 p.m. www.women.com Chat with Jane Seymour, an actress, about her role in ''Yesterday's Children,'' a new film.

WEDNESDAY, 7 p.m. www.bn.com Chat with the author Alice Walker about her book ''The Way Forward Is With a Broken Heart,'' which weaves autobiographical elements and fictional stories to explore love and lost relationships across several generations.
www.vpcentre.net Veep World, a site about the vice presidency, with short biographies, memorable quotations and a look at what happened to some vice presidents after they left office.
www.weather.com/outdoors/fall Fall foliage reports for 40 states, as the leaves change to red, yellow and orange.

www.peoplespot.com A Web site with links to directories and search engines for philanthropic organizations, alumni listings and online clubs, support groups and news groups. For information about people, sorted various ways, there are also links to the Census Bureau, cemetery sites, population predictors and collections of biographies of artists, political leaders and scientists.
